title: Winter Storm Causes Flight Cancellations, Weather Warnings Across U.S.
summary: More than 2,000 U.S. flights canceled; authorities in several states urge people to avoid roads. A potentially dangerous winter storm brought snow, freezing rain and sleet to much of the central and northern U.S. Wednesday.

title: The Moral Cost of Doing Business in China
summary: Troublesome findings in a new report from the Victims of Communism Memorial Foundation.. American and other Western companies have long been eager to do business in China, and that made sense when the country was opening to the world and reforming its economy. But operating in China has become more problematic as President Xi Jinping has tightened his political grip on the country and reversed market reforms.

title: Winter Olympics 2022: What to Know About the Beijing Games
summary: Never before has one city hosted both summer and winter editions of the Games. The Winter Olympics will get under way in Beijing, China, this month-less than six months after the postponed 2021 Summer Olympics wrapped up in Tokyo, Japan. Much of the competition that takes place in Beijing will occur in venues originally constructed for the Summer Games.

title: 'No' on Sarah Bloom Raskin
summary: Biden's appointee for Fed vice chairman is intent on destroying fossil fuels, no matter the economic cost.. These are precarious times for the American economy. Inflation has reached generational highs while the stock market is experiencing its most significant pullback since March 2020. As it responds, the Federal Reserve is walking a financial tightrope: Raise interest rates too little and inflation gets worse; raise interest rates too much and the economy crashes. But while central bankers are trying to maintain their balance, President Biden is cutting the rope.

title: Eric Adams Seems Serious About Crime. Is Biden?
summary: The president meets the new mayor in New York as the city buries its second police officer in a week.. President Biden will meet with New York City Mayor Eric Adams Thursday, in a belated acknowledgment of the violent crime surge that began with the George Floyd riots of 2020. Mr. Biden arrives in New York following the second funeral for a policeman in less than a week. Officers Jason Rivera and Wilbert Mora were responding to a domestic-violence call at a Harlem apartment on Jan. 21. A man emerged from a bedroom, shooting, and continued to shoot Rivera and Mora as they lay on the ground, in what a police source calls an "execution." Rivera, 22, died at the scene; Mora, 27, a bullet lodged in his brain, was taken off life support four days later.

title: MetLife's Earnings Surge, but Covid Limits Results
summary: Allstate's net income fell 70% in fourth quarter as vehicle crashes increased on more-crowded roads. High levels of Covid-19 deaths hurt fourth-quarter results in MetLife Inc.'s business of providing employer-sponsored life insurance as the Delta variant persisted in the U.S., but the outsize payouts were more than offset by unusually strong investment gains.

title: Raskin Faces Senate Questions Over Climate Views
summary: Nominee for key Federal Reserve job set to appear before Senate Banking Committee for hearing. WASHINGTON-Sarah Bloom Raskin, President Biden's pick to become the government's most influential bank regulator, could face a contentious hearing on Thursday when she testifies before Senate lawmakers, a key hurdle for confirmation.

title: The Be More Like China Act
summary: The House competition bill is industrial policy mixed with welfare.. If imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, Chinese President Xi Jinping should feel honored by the 2,900-page bill House Democrats claim will make the U.S. more competitive. To counter China, Democrats think America must copy Beijing's industrial policy.

title: Why Ukraine Matters to the U.S.
summary: Giving Putin what he wants won't make the China challenge easier.. The Biden Administration announced Wednesday that it will soon deploy thousands of U.S. troops to shore up NATO's eastern flank. It's the right decision with more than 100,000 Russian troops along Ukraine's borders.

title: The Twilight of Covid Mandates in Europe
summary: The U.K. ditches a diktat for health staff as other leaders rethink how to live with the virus.. The Biden Administration isn't the only government rethinking Covid vaccine mandates. The Occupational Safety and Health Administration quietly dropped its mandate after a rebuke from the Supreme Court, and some leaders in Europe are also finally getting serious about learning to live with the virus.

title: Growth Hedge Funds Suffer Worst Rout in Years
summary: January troubles add to 2021 losses for many funds. Stock markets' selloff in January dealt double-digit losses to a range of hedge funds investing in technology and other fast-growing companies, sparking questions about whether a popular and lucrative strategy for these firms is running out of steam.

title: Requiescat in Pace, Alma
summary: Covid took my sister, a compassionate, tough soul who always put others first.. Tuesday morning, the hospital wouldn't let me say goodbye to my sister. Covid restrictions, they said. Only Alma's two daughters, masked and gowned, were allowed in with their mother as she lay in a hospital bed, sedated and intubated. Then doctors and nurses removed her life-maintaining support. A short time later she died, holding her daughters' hands.

title: Spotify, Facing Pushback Against Joe Rogan, Reports Jump in Users
summary: CEO says past few weeks 'have presented a number of learning opportunities' from the protest against the company's star podcaster. Spotify Technology SA added more users and saw a surge in advertising revenue in its recently completed quarter as its podcast strategy takes hold despite backlash to its star host.

title: A Risky Time for Venture Funds
summary: Potential conflicts of interest, ties with China, and excessive leverage are among the challenges.. Venture and buyout funds are hugely popular-and also imperiled by ethical and other problems. I have a long history with such funds. As an adviser to Yale in the 1970s, I recommended that it make its first venture-capital investment. I gave similar advice to Harvard and other universities.

title: End the Covid Panic Now
summary: Biden should declare the pandemic is over, so Americans can return to normal lives.. It is manifestly clear that the panic phase of the Covid-19 pandemic has to end. The costs are too high.

title: Michael Avenatti Fraud Case Goes to Jury
summary: In closing arguments, accused lawyer again tries to undermine testimony of former client Stormy Daniels. A federal jury began deliberations in the fraud trial of Michael Avenatti Wednesday afternoon after the disgraced celebrity lawyer and prosecutors clashed over whether he fleeced his former client Stormy Daniels out of money from a book deal.

title: 'The Power Law' Review: Chasing Unicorns
summary: Venture capital is deﬁned by its most brilliant successes. A few deals explain the majority of returns, a few wild ideas change the world.. The average venture-capital fund launched in 2011 outperformed the S&P 500 by 7% per year. But that statistic understates the astronomical returns earned by a few top performers-and the mediocre returns earned by the rest. Between 1979 and 2018, the median fund underperformed the S&P 500, while the top 5% of funds nearly tripled the index's performance.

title: PayPal Tumbles After Disappointing Earnings Guidance
summary: Payments company lowers its 2022 profit outlook and scraps an ambitious growth strategy it put in place last year. PayPal Holdings Inc. shares suffered their worst selloff on record after the company lowered its 2022 profit outlook and scrapped an ambitious growth strategy it put in place last year.

title: Qualcomm Posts Strong Earnings, as Demand for Chips Stays High
summary: Handset sales remain the main driver of chip company's top-line growth; CEO pursues diversification. Qualcomm Inc. posted strong quarterly earnings and gave an upbeat sales outlook, underscoring that demand for chips for everything from smartphones to cars remains elevated.

title: 'Svadba' Review: Recorded Rites
summary: Boston Lyric Opera and Opera Philadelphia collaborate on a film of Ana Sokolović's work, about a group of women preparing their friend for her wedding day..

title: Four Men Arrested in Overdose Death of 'The Wire' Actor
summary: Men charged as members of an alleged fentanyl and heroin conspiracy that authorities link to the death of the 54-year-old actor. Four men have been charged in the overdose death of "The Wire" actor Michael K. Williams, the U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York said Wednesday.

title: Neil Young, Joe Rogan Podcast and Spotify: What to Know
summary: As the podcaster responds to controversy, here's what to know about tensions surrounding his show. Spotify Technology SA has been facing public scrutiny over content from Joe Rogan on its platform after musician Neil Young pulled his music from the streaming service in objection to what he said was misinformation by the company's star podcaster. On Jan. 30, Mr. Rogan responded in a 10-minute Instagram video post and pledged to be more balanced and informed about controversial topics and guests. Spotify earlier that day published its platform policies, which it said were longstanding and developed internally with the help of outside experts.

title: Stocks End Higher After Strong Alphabet Earnings
summary: Strong earnings report from Google parent Alphabet outweighs weak economic data. U.S. stocks rose Wednesday, extending their winning streak, as a strong earnings report from Google parent Alphabet outweighed weak economic reports.

title: Arizona Home Asking $30.6 Million Is the State's Most Expensive Listing
summary: The Paradise Valley home is slated to have a bowling alley, golf simulator; construction has yet to start. The most expensive home for sale in Arizona isn't even built yet.

title: Nuclear Power, Natural Gas Secure EU Backing as 'Green' Investments
summary: Proposal to expand what can qualify as sustainable investment sparked outcry from some member states, investors. BRUSSELS-Brushing aside charges of greenwashing, the European Union will press ahead with a controversial proposal to label certain nuclear energy and natural-gas investments as sustainable over the coming years despite strong opposition from some of the bloc's member states, environmental groups and investors.

title: FBI Identifies People of Interest in Bomb Threats Against Black Colleges
summary: Juveniles linked to disguised phone number are being investigated for hate crimes. WASHINGTON-The FBI has identified at least six people of interest in a rash of bomb threats directed at places of worship and historically Black colleges and universities, law-enforcement officials said Wednesday. The incidents are being investigated as racially motivated extremism and hate crimes, authorities said.

title: U.S. to Send Jet Fighters, Warship to U.A.E. After Houthi Attacks
summary: Move comes as Yemen's Houthi rebels vow to continue their attacks on the U.A.E.. The U.S. is sending advanced jet fighters and a guided-missile destroyer to the United Arab Emirates to help it counter an escalating threat from Yemen's Houthi rebels after the Iran-backed group launched a series of missiles and drones at the Persian Gulf nation.

title: Responses to Moscow's Demands Show Gulf Between Russia and West
summary: Resume Subscription. MOSCOW-The gap between Russia and the West over the future of Ukraine and security in Europe was laid bare as details of two bluntly worded responses delivered to Moscow last week were made public, showing the U.S. and NATO rejected the Kremlin's demands and instead blamed the tension on Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: A Valentine's Day Dessert Recipe That's Unabashedly Romantic
summary: Simple, rich, creamy and not too sweet, this heart-shaped French dessert with a subtly boozy sauce makes an elegant alternative to the ubiquitous box of chocolates. HEART-SHAPED SWEETS are never in short supply at this time of year. From cellophane-wrapped boxes of chocolates to Sweethearts candies beseeching "Be Mine," the usual edible modes of making one's feelings known come Feb. 14 are widely-almost oppressively-available. Wouldn't it be so much nicer to introduce an element of surprise this time around? For those seeking something more unexpected and still unabashedly lovey-dovey, the answer is a rich, luscious coeur à la crème-French for cream heart.

title: Tom Who? Brady Is Famous in Brazil-as Husband of Brazilian Supermodel
summary: Gisele Bündchen is beloved in her homeland, where American football sows confusion and Brady plays second fiddle. SÃO PAULO-Tom Brady may go down as the National Football League's most legendary quarterback, but here in Brazil he is simply "Giselo"-husband to Gisele Bündchen, the Brazilian supermodel.

title: As Omicron Shows Signs of Peaking in Europe, France Eases Restrictions
summary: Covid-19 cases in Germany continue to break records daily, but have been falling in states with highest incidences. France allowed workers to return to offices full time Wednesday amid signs the Omicron wave of Covid-19 is approaching its peak in Europe.

title: Alexander Vindman Sues Donald Trump Jr., Rudy Giuliani
summary: Retired Army officer accused them of carrying out intimidation, retaliation campaign in response to impeachment testimony. Retired Lt. Col. Alexander Vindman has sued Donald Trump Jr., Rudy Giuliani and other associates, alleging that they conspired to intimidate him from testifying against President Donald Trump during his first impeachment hearing.

title: Strip Tease (Thursday Crossword, February 3)
New York Times Tops 10 Million Subscriptions as Profit Soars
summary: News publisher increases dividend, sets new target of 15 million total subscribers by end of 2027. New York Times Co. said it surpassed its goal of 10 million subscriptions years ahead of schedule, partly thanks to its recent acquisition of sports-media company the Athletic, while profit rose sharply on the back of strong advertising-revenue growth.

title: David Crosby, Stephen Stills Join Neil Young's Protest of Spotify, Joe Rogan
summary: Members of rock supergroup Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young cite vaccine misinformation for decision to pull music from steaming service. Musicians David Crosby and Stephen Stills are joining their former bandmate Neil Young in his protest against Spotify Technology SA , saying they want to pull their music from the platform over their opposition to what they say is misinformation about Covid-19 spread by podcaster Joe Rogan.

title: AMC Entertainment Refinances Pricey Pandemic Debt
summary: The theater company received investor commitments for a money-saving bond deal, despite a selloff that has called into question the longevity of its meme-stock status. AMC Entertainment Holdings Inc. struck a deal to refinance expensive debt it took on in the early days of the pandemic, as it vies to revive the investor enthusiasm that made the company a centerpiece of the meme-stock phenomenon.

title: The Lockdown Catastrophe
summary: Where are the public health benefits to justify Covid-era shutdowns and spending?. Government disease doctors and politicians around the world panicked in the face of Covid and began shutting down societies in early 2020. The accounting has hardly begun on the impact of isolating human beings, denying them opportunities, education and experiences-not to mention disrupting non-Covid medical treatments and myriad other valuable services-and then attempting to simulate the benefits of a functioning society by printing fiat money. It will take years to understand the full cost of this man-made catastrophe, But emerging research suggests that on the other side of the ledger, public health benefits were extremely small, if they can be verified at all.

title: Some Havana Syndrome Cases Likely Caused by Electromagnetic Waves, Panel Finds
summary: Acoustic devices are a second likely cause of the debilitating condition, say intelligence experts. WASHINGTON-Some incidents of the debilitating medical condition known as Havana Syndrome are most likely caused by directed energy or acoustic devices and can't be explained by other factors, a panel of U.S. intelligence analysts and outside experts reported on Wednesday.

title: U.S., European Allies Plan How to Protect Ukraine From Russian Hacks
summary: Officials fear cyberattacks could affect other countries in Eastern Europe. BRUSSELS-U.S. officials are coordinating with European allies to determine the most effective ways to help Ukraine fend off potential Russian cyberattacks while seeking to protect digital systems in their own countries.

title: Europe's Energy Crisis Eases Even as Ukraine-Russia Tensions Build
summary: Influx of U.S. gas tankers, mild and windy weather, and boost to flows from Russia slow decline in gas stockpiles. Hopes are rising that Europe will avoid a winter energy crisis that some feared would play to Russian President Vladimir Putin's advantage as Moscow prepares for a possible invasion of Ukraine.

title: This Easy, Elegant Cheese Puff Recipe Is the Ultimate Pairing for Champagne
summary: If you want something worth donning sequins for this Valentine's Day, bake these Parmesan and mushroom gougères. A FRIEND OF MINE recently compared locked-down New York City to a Champagne bottle, full of bubbles and ready to pop. Aren't we all? At this point, I'd go to the opening of an envelope. Lead me to an overflowing Champagne tower. I want some romance, a conga line, elaborate synchronized swimming routines, black tie, lipstick and off-the-shoulder sequins. I'm ready to dance the night away as waiters glide past on roller skates, balancing trays full of these piquant gougères.

title: New York Times Resists Tech Workers' Union Push
summary: Tensions come amid wave of organizing at U.S. media outlets; company also at odds with main newsroom union over new contract. New York Times Co. is resisting a unionization effort by its technology workers and is battling the newsroom's main union over the creation of new holidays as labor strife at the publisher intensifies.

title: What to Watch: 'Pam & Tommy,' Plus Three More Things to Stream This Week
summary: 'Reacher' comes to Prime Video; yet another star-studded comedy murder mystery, 'Murderville,' comes to Netflix and how to watch the Olympics. Pamela Anderson and Tommy Lee's sex tape saga is a Hulu series, and Jack Reacher is a lot bigger than Tom Cruise in Prime Video's "Reacher." Plus, Peacock may have figured out how to make it easy for you to watch the Winter Olympics. Here's where to stream it all:

title: Is This Racial Injustice at the Supreme Court?
summary: Biden could have simply selected a black woman, without demeaning the nominee and the court.. Regarding Jonathan Turley's op-ed "A College Couldn't Get Away With Biden's High-Court Criteria" (Jan. 27): President Biden's criteria for the Supreme Court is blatantly discriminatory toward the qualified noncandidates-the white females and the black and white males who will not even be considered for this vacancy.

title: Zuckerberg's Money and the 2020 Election in Wisconsin
summary: The injection of $10 million into election offices played a role in juicing turnout.. Regarding your editorial "The Best Summary of the 2020 Election" (Jan. 26): The Wisconsin Institute for Law and Liberty (WILL) report includes a flawed estimate of the quantitative impact of the Mark Zuckerberg-funded Center for Tech and Civic Life (CTCL) injection of around $10.3 million into Wisconsin election offices, about 90% of which went to a handful of Wisconsin's most heavily Democratic cities.

title: Selfishness Starts With Littering in the Park
summary: But sadly for the society, it never ends there.. Regarding Daniel Henninger's column "America's Mindlessness Epidemic" (Wonder Land, Jan. 27): This ignorant selfishness is so revealed in New York's Central Park, where I work as a volunteer. I see lawns used as garbage bins for doggy-poop bags; debris tossed into bushes and under benches; paper napkins rolled into bits small enough to wedge between the slats of the park benches; bikers who ride, often at high speeds, on paths reserved for walkers, and are ready to use the f-word if you ask them not to; and beer and soda cans thrown into the Harlem Meer and other pools in the park.

title: For Our Own Sake, Help Poorer Nations Fight Covid
summary: It is in our best interest to provide Covid-19 assistance to lower-income countries and stop the next variant in its tracks.. As a global community in our third year of the Covid pandemic, we need to focus on the effect of this virus on low-income countries ("Global Crunch Hits U.S. Particularly Hard." U.S. News, Jan. 25). The economic impact of the Omicron variant has led to lost livelihoods all around the world.

title: You Don't Want an American Dairy Cartel
summary: Take it from someone who knows: a Canadian consumer.. Niaz Dorry of the National Family Farm Coalition tells only half the story on Canada's national milk-production cartel (Letters, Jan. 24). As a Canadian consumer, I can see that the missing piece is the dramatic difference in dairy-product prices between our nation and yours. The price fixing by our version of Big Dairy costs the Canadian consumer hundreds of millions of dollars, if not billions, every year due to its government-sanctioned monopolistic practices. Do not even think about going down that road.

title: EA Will Stand Fine Alone
summary: 'Battlefield' misfire hurts, but Electronic Arts holds a diverse lineup that will keep business strong even as rivals get swallowed up in M&A wave. Electronic Arts will survive its Battlefield wound just fine. Thriving in the videogame industry's consolidation war might be a little trickier, as the soon-to-be largest independent publisher seems likely to remain a solo player.

title: Activist Investors Take Aim at U.K. Inc.
summary: Elliott Management, Third Point and Trian Fund Management are among the firms pushing for changes at big U.K. companies. U.S. and European activist investors are targeting some of the U.K.'s biggest publicly traded companies, taking advantage of slumping stock prices to push for company breakups and other changes.

title: The New Secret to Online Dating Success? Your Voice
summary: Popular dating apps like Hinge are giving users the ability to add voice recordings to their digital profiles-and singles who speak up are finding more matches. NEARLY 40 AND SINGLE, Tracy Morris had been online dating for a while, but she wasn't about to settle. Not for the man who turned out to have a whiny, mewling voice; its weak quality made her feel unsafe. Nor for the one who spoke in short, chopped, angry sentences. "Voice is a pheromone to me," said Ms. Morris, a McLean, Virginia-based interior designer. "I think it's one of the senses."

title: TikTok Hires Panasonic Executive to Expand Compliance Function
summary: Catherine Razzano will oversee legal compliance issues at the social-media company, as its popular video-sharing app faces scrutiny in the U.S. over potential security risks. title: Revolt of the Canadian Truckers
summary: The 'Freedom Convoy' has galvanized citizens and raised millions.. Toronto

title: We're All Whoopi Goldberg Now
summary: Who sounds off in ignorance? These days, who doesn't?. It was a bad moment when Whoopi Goldberg asserted on "The View" that the Holocaust wasn't about race but about "man's inhumanity to man." Her comment, limited by her understanding of the American black-white binary of race, was historically uninformed. Hitler identified Jews as an inferior race and specifically targeted them for extermination. Nazi ideas were deeply influenced by Joseph Arthur de Gobineau (1816-82), who believed Germanic "Aryans" were superior to all other whites and nonwhites alike.

title: Coke's Olympic Sponsorship Is on Display in China, Not in U.S.
summary: Coca-Cola grabbed more of the sponsorship pie before the Beijing Games, but in the U.S. its expanded involvement is easy to miss. Coca-Cola Co. has been an Olympics supporter for nearly a century. It counts China as its third-largest market after the U.S. and Mexico. Coke's challenges heading into the Winter Games are in some ways representative of those of other Western sponsors, and in some ways distinct. Here is a look at the company's business dealings in China and its Olympic plans as the 2022 Winter Olympics are set to begin in Beijing this week.

title: PayPal's Downshift Shows Two-Speed Spending Outlook
summary: While the company's shares are tumbling after it cut its 2022 outlook, other payments stocks are rallying on hopes of higher travel spending. The question of who is likely to spend even faster in the near future-and who might not be-is roiling payments stocks.

title: Melinda French Gates No Longer Pledges Bulk of Wealth to Foundation
summary: Billionaire still promises to give away fortune, cites Pivotal Ventures and Gates Foundation in new Giving Pledge letter. Melinda French Gates is no longer pledging to give the bulk of her wealth to the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and instead plans to spread it among philanthropic endeavors, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Groundhog Day 2022: Punxsutawney Phil Sees His Shadow
summary: Tradition says one can expect six more weeks of winter this year. A look at how this annual weather-predicting practice started.. Punxsutawney Phil, the groundhog that predicts the weather every February, saw its shadow Wednesday, meaning it anticipates six more weeks of winter this year.

summary: Resume Subscription. A private Connecticut island originally listed for $175 million is back on the market for $100 million.

The federal civil-rights trial of three former Minneapolis police officers stemming from the killing of George Floyd was suspended after one of them tested positive for Covid-19, Judge Paul Magnuson said in court Wednesday.

title: Insurance Analyst Found Mission in Visits to Death Row
summary: Thomas G. Rosencrants, who has died at age 72, befriended inmates at a Louisiana penitentiary. Thomas G. title: This New Company Is Betting Big on Nuclear Power in America

Exelon Corp. on Wednesday spun off its power-generation business into a stand-alone company. The spinoff's future might hinge on whether the government increases its financial support for nuclear energy in response to climate change.

title: The Commanders: Washington's NFL Team Announces New Name
summary: The club dropped its longtime moniker, the Redskins, in 2020 after amplified criticisms that it was derogatory toward Native Americans. Washington's NFL team finally has a new name: the Commanders.

WASHINGTON-Joe Biden said during his presidential campaign that he would reduce student debt for millions of Americans, but his allies remain divided on the issue, and some of his supporters are losing hope he will deliver.

title: How Rent Hikes Make Buying a House Even Harder
summary: Rising rents are pushing many to buy a home even if the housing market is already tough. Rising rents are one of the main drivers in the recent bout of inflation. They are also spurring many renters to try to buy a home as quickly as possible.

summary: Five management experts give advice on how companies can reinvent ways they compensate and manage workers to stay competitive in a post-pandemic world. Author

summary: Presidents Eisenhower, Johnson, Nixon and Reagan used high-court appointments to send political signals and push legal agendas. WASHINGTON-Some Senate Republicans are criticizing President Biden's pledge to place a Black woman on the Supreme Court, arguing he is paying a debt to a partisan constituency rather than seeking the most qualified nominee. But the practice of filling Supreme Court slots to court particular voter groups has a long bipartisan history.

title: JD.com Founder Donates More Than $2 Billion in Stock

summary: Resume Subscription. An extensive buildup of barriers along China's 3,000-mile southern border is under way, according to public documents, official statements and interviews with residents, ostensibly to battle Covid-19 but with likely long-lasting ramifications on trade and travel.

title: Top Public and Private Colleges in the Northeast
summary: U.S. Military Academy, Harvard head these lists in the WSJ/THE College Rankings. Harvard University is the region's top private school, one of five Northeastern private schools ranked among the nation's top 10 schools of any kind, and nine in the top 20.

title: OPEC, Allies Agree to Pump More Oil Amid Supply Concerns
summary: Oil prices have risen in part because some OPEC+ members have been unable to meet their share of output. OPEC and its allies agreed to a small, planned increase in crude production amid soaring oil prices, with concerns over supply heightened due to a possible Russian invasion of Ukraine.

summary: Pop-up locations nationwide are delivering late or false results and stealing personal information, law-enforcement officials say. Officials nationwide are trying to stay ahead of a proliferation of Covid-19 test sites that they say are offering fraudulent services to the public.

title: The Pros and Cons of Buying an Older Home
summary: They come with character and charm, but repairs, insurance and historic commission rules can make the purchase of an older property more complicated than new homeowners realize. Brian Sanders, 47, co-owner of a McMinnville, Ore., car dealership, and his wife, Heather, 29, didn't set out to purchase a 90-year-old home, but when they began their search last year, the options were limited. They wanted to be close to their children's schools and few homes were on the market. So the couple purchased a six-bedroom home in Vancouver, Wash., last summer for $2.95 million. The Old Portland-style home, which was extensively remodeled, has a sitting room, formal living and dining rooms, hardwood floors and a $250,000 home theater. He loves it, even though two bathrooms need remodeling and his four air-conditioning units and four furnaces may need replacement soon. "The wainscoting has character, and the quality of the craftsmanship is phenomenal," he said.

title: U.S. and Ukraine Differ Over Russian Threat, Worrying Both
summary: Kyiv, long threatened by Moscow, wants to prevent panic and save its economy, while some in Washington fear complacency. title: The Best Black Wardrobe Staples That Go Way Beyond Basic
summary: They're investment pieces in classic black-with a twist..

title: A Magical Live-Work Retreat on Long Island
summary: Architect Elizabeth Roberts is an authority on the Brooklyn townhouse. But as more clients branch out from the city, she's set up a Long Island compound to take her work in new directions.. Back in March 2020, architect Elizabeth Roberts, 53, suddenly found herself running her Brooklyn-based business from an unheated, uninsulated old barn on her property in Bellport, Long Island, where she, her physician husband and their teenage son had decamped to ride out the pandemic. But after six months of typing emails in frigid and roasting temperatures, and being the only one of her staff available to take meetings with, say, the tile grout guy in East Hampton, she was dreaming of setting up a compound-one where her employees could stay over if needed by clients who increasingly have projects outside of the city, where her California-based mother could safely visit, where artistic friends could retreat to concoct projects and where Roberts herself could sketch, play music and attend to her ever-growing company's many demands.

title: U.S. Moving-Some Say Too Slowly-to Address TikTok Security Risk
summary: Commerce Department proposes rule to widen restrictions on Chinese apps; Sen. Marco Rubio says administration is taking timid steps on data security. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration is moving to revise federal rules to address potential security risks from TikTok and other foreign-owned apps, eight months after opting not to pursue a forced shutdown of the Chinese-owned video-sharing platform.

title: GM Signals an Easing of the Car Shortage
summary: General Motors expects to boost production as chip supplies improve, giving dealers more to sell and possibly keeping a lid on inflation. Getting your hands on a new car should become easier this year. The big question for both consumers and investors is at what price.

title: Teachers Are Quitting, and Companies Are Hot to Hire Them
summary: Most Popular News. Burned out teachers are leaving the classroom for jobs in the private sector, where talent-hungry companies are hiring them-and often boosting their pay-to work in sales, software, healthcare and training, among other fields.

title: Ripple's Legal Brawl With SEC Could Help Settle When Cryptocurrencies Are Securities
summary: An SEC win would boost its case to regulate much of the crypto market, while a loss would reinforce calls for clearer laws. WASHINGTON-The booming cryptocurrency sector's complaints that Washington has gone too far in cracking down on its unregulated products are getting tested in a key lawsuit targeting Ripple Labs Inc. and its digital coin, XRP.

title: Eurozone Inflation Rises to Fresh Record, Against Expectations
summary: Economists had long expected inflation to fall, but a fresh surge in energy prices delivered a major surprise. The eurozone's inflation rate rose to a fresh record high in January, an unwelcome surprise for policy makers at the European Central Bank who have said they don't expect to raise their key interest rate this year.

title: The Green Boogeyman Is Flying Supersonic
summary: Ultrafast jet startup Boom Supersonic has a site for its first full-scale manufacturing facility, but sustainable-fuel availability and environmental concerns are big obstacles. Supersonic jets may not be quick enough to outpace the Green Movement.

title: Good Thing VCs Didn't Get the Last Wordle
summary: Fans who worried the word-guessing game would change after selling to the New York Times should consider that it could have been so much worse. A picture is worth a thousand words, but one word is apparently worth seven figures.

title: How Berets Became a Part of Black History, From the Black Panthers to Beyoncé
summary: Long associated with revolutionaries and protest groups, the loaded accessory is seeing a resurgence. SOMETIME IN LATE 1966, two college students watched an old World War II film about the French Resistance. Inspired by the characters' revolutionary zeal and style, one turned to the other and said, "Let's wear berets, man."

title: As Ukraine Prepares for Cyberattacks, Officials Warn of Ransomware in Disguise
summary: Russia, other countries might use software to destroy data, mask government involvement, cyber experts say. As investigators in Ukraine continue to trace a January cyberattack that disrupted government websites and wiped data on computer systems, government officials and cybersecurity experts are preparing for another incident.

title: Match Hopes Hinge Can Be Its Knight in Shining Armor
summary: Match shares fell after reporting mixed fourth-quarter results. Investors might be missing the bigger picture.. Dating giant Match Group is finally showing a little more skin, lest investors start to lose interest. The question is whether their heads have already turned.

title: EV Charging Stations Get Bigger and Brighter
summary: Larger footprints, more signs and prominent locations can help turn the heads of gas-powered-vehicle drivers, some executives say. Public charging stations for electric vehicles once tended to be confined to the dark corners of parking lots and highway rest stops. Now they are getting more obvious.

title: Great Hill Partners' Chris Gaffney Reflects on Tech Investing After Raising $4.65 Billion
summary: Recent tech-stock volatility is regarded as resulting from a cyclical-and temporary-rotation out of the sector. Great Hill Partners has closed its latest fund with $4.65 billion to invest in midmarket technology-enabled companies.

title: Sorry, the Global Supply Chain Ate My Homework
summary: Businesses are apologizing for their inability to deliver, so why can't the rest of us?. When Jack White was planning his first live tour since the pandemic, the rock musician tapped into the Covid-era zeitgeist and called it "The Supply Chain Issues Tour."

title: AI Could Cut Hiring Biases as Companies Make Push for Workers, Proponents Say
summary: While the potential for bias in AI has been a concern, some say well-crafted algorithms can help companies be fairer in their hiring decisions. The use of artificial intelligence to aid in companies' sensitive decision making has long made U.S. regulators wary, particularly for its potential to supercharge human bias.

title: Consumers Are Pivoting Spending to Services From Goods
summary: With many consumers tapped out on buying physical goods, economists hope warmer weather and waning infections will kick-start service purchases. Americans responded to the pandemic with a dramatic shift in spending to goods from services. That now appears to be reversing and should gather steam as the Omicron wave of Covid-19 ebbs, economists say.

title: Amazon Alabama Workers Set for Union Bid Revote
summary: Resume Subscription. Amazon.com Inc. workers at a company warehouse in Alabama are set to begin voting for the second time in a year on whether to unionize.

title: Coup Bid Thwarted in Guinea-Bissau After Gunfire Heard in Capital
summary: A spate of coups has spread across West Africa over the past 18 months. KAMPALA, Uganda-Heavy gunfire raged at the main government complex in Guinea-Bissau, fanning fears that the West African nation was on the brink of becoming the latest country in the region to see a coup before soldiers thwarted the attempted power grab, its leader said.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Whoopi Goldberg Suspended From 'The View' After Holocaust Remarks
summary: During a broadcast the moderator said the Holocaust was 'not about race,' but rather 'man's inhumanity to man'. ABC News said it has suspended Whoopi Goldberg for two weeks as the moderator of its daytime talk show "The View" after she made controversial remarks on Monday's broadcast regarding the root causes of the Holocaust.

title: New York Times Loves Unions-Except at the New York Times
summary: Not even the Gray Lady wants to live by the rules she demands of others.. One reason the New York Times has become insufferable for readers outside of the activist left is that the former newspaper of record demands an increasingly costly and unrealistic agenda for managing American lifestyles and livelihoods. Two stories today suggest the Times can't bear it any more easily than most readers can.

title: U.S. National Debt Exceeds $30 Trillion for First Time
summary: Increase from pre-pandemic levels fueled by trillions of dollars spent on aid programs for small businesses, workers and others. WASHINGTON-The U.S. national debt exceeded $30 trillion for the first time, reflecting increased federal borrowing during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Native American Tribes Reach $590 Million Opioid Settlement
summary: Drugmaker to pay $150 million over two years; distributors to pay more than $439.9 million over seven years. Johnson & Johnson and three major U.S. drug distributors agreed to pay nearly $590 million to Native American tribes heavily affected by the opioid crisis to resolve litigation against the companies.

title: Avenatti Rests Defense Without Calling Witnesses in Fraud Trial
summary: Former lawyer declines to take the stand after signaling he would; closing arguments are set for Wednesday. Disgraced celebrity lawyer Michael Avenatti rested his defense Tuesday against federal fraud allegations without calling a single witness and declining to testify in his own defense.

title: Pfizer Asks FDA to Authorize Its Covid-19 Shot for Young Kids
summary: Use of the shots among children ages 6 months to under 5 years could gain regulators' go-ahead in March. Pfizer Inc. and partner BioNTech SE asked U.S. health regulators to authorize use of their Covid-19 vaccine in children under 5 years, the last age group without access to the shots.

title: Trump Fires Back in New York Subpoena Fight
summary: State's attorney general seeks testimony from former president and two of his children in civil-fraud investigation. Lawyers for former President Donald Trump and two of his adult children argued Tuesday that the New York state attorney general's office had targeted them unfairly in its civil-fraud investigation and subpoenaed information that could be improperly used in a separate criminal probe.

title: Democratic Sen. Ben Ray Luján Hospitalized for Stroke
summary: New Mexico lawmaker's absence leaves Democrats short of a crucial vote in Senate while he recovers. WASHINGTON-Sen. Ben Ray Luján (D., N.M.) suffered a stroke and had surgery to ease swelling in his brain, his top aide said Tuesday, leaving Democrats short of a crucial vote in the 50-50 Senate while he recovers.

title: Starbucks Sales Rise as Cost Pressures Increase
summary: Staffing levels, pandemic restrictions remain hurdles, company says; price increases aid margins. Starbucks Corp. said rising costs of supplies and wages will continue to weigh on the coffee giant's profit in the months ahead after pandemic-related restrictions reappeared in the U.S. and overseas.
